title: Help With Masteries (Champion Types)
body:
I know this isn't the best way to do it (as my friend said), but I'm only level 23, and perfectionist who likes things tidy, and also a tad lazy.
Basically, I am trying to create a Mysteries page for each type of champion type, and I was wondering if I've gotten any of these wrong, or if there are champ types you can add to it.


**TOP**
Tank
Bruiser

**MIDDLE**
Ability Power (AP Carry)
Attack Damage (Assassin)

**BOTTOM**
Attack Damage (AD Carry)
*I feel as though there is one more champ in this section

**SUPPORT** 
Classic (Sona, Soraka etc...)
Caster (Annie, Zyra etc...)
Tank (Blitzcrank, Malphite etc...)

**JUNGLE**
Ability Power
Attack Damage
Tank

replies.body: I'll get to this after school.

Here's a list of mastery pages I have:
- **AD** Used for any Attack Damage biased damage champion (Usually Marksmen and Assassins). As has been mentioned it could be worth it to have seperate pages for ADCs and AD Casters.
- **AP** Used for any Ability Power biased damage champions, "APCs" (Usually Mages and Assassins).
- **Hybrid Damage** Used for any damage champion which has some balance between AD and AP (Ezreal and Corki are good examples, though I don't play them).
- **AD Bruiser** Used for any tanky damage dealer biased to Attack Damage (Usually Fighters).
- **AP Bruiser** Used for any tanky damage dealer biased to Ability Power (Usually Tanks such as Maokai or Mages such as Ryze).
- **Hybrid Bruiser** Used for tanky damage dealers which have some balance between AD and AP. For somewhat obvious reasons I rarely use this.
- **Tank** Used for champions that are best as tanks (Champs like Sion or Garen).
- **Jungle** Bit obvious, used for jungling. Really this one goes un-used since I tend to avoid jungling when I play on SR and, as a result, I only have one for AD.
- **Utility** Generally used for supports or support champs. I actually have two versions, one for mana users and one for champs without mana.

Hope this will help. Might even give a look back later and see what you come up with to update mine.

What is an "Attack Damage Caster"?

Typically, Attack Damage Casters are champions who focus strongly on damage dealt by abilities that scale with Attack Damage. 

This is different from a typical Marksman / ADC, as they tend to focus on damage from auto-attacks instead. Some ADCs like Graves or Varus can fit in both areas.

Attack Damage Casters tend to scale with Attack Damage, Armour Penetration and Cooldown Reduciton
ADCs tend to scale with Attack Damage, Attack Speed, Crit Chance, Crit Damage, with a side of Armour Pen. 

AD Casters tend to be champions like Pantheon, Jayce, Zed or Talon
ADCs are more like Tristana, Caitlyn, Jinx or Lucian.

Ahhh tyvm, might take a while for me to remember it all, but is there a way of telling what champion scales off what?

In general, between Casters and Marksman, you can tell what's better to build by how you tend to play them. If you're relying on abilities to deal damage, you want Attack Damage, Armour Penetration and Cooldown Reduciton.

If you're relying on auto attacks, you want ADCs tend to scale with Attack Damage, Attack Speed, Crit Chance, Crit Damage, with a side of Armour Pen.

In terms of whether it's an attack damage or ability scaling move, you can check the colour on the ability. Green -> Ability Power, Orange -> Attack Damage.

> also one more thing, can you play AD casters on bot lane along side the support in the current meta, or only Ad casters?

It's generally more common to see a few champions that straddle both roles there - Graves has very strong burst abilities with awesome scaling, but also works very well as a normal marksman with his E's attack speed buff. Varus is also played there as well, who regularly goes an AD caster style builder and pokes with his long range Q. 

That said, if the rest of your team is comfortable with it, there's no problem changing up what is generally played in the meta. 
One of my favourite botlanes that I've seen lately is Cho'Gath/Blitzcrank - it's a pretty amazing lockdown and burst at level 6, as long as you have some good lategame scaling in your other lanes.

Cheers :)
